name: Systems of Linear Equations Word Problems

problems.q: At a school play, adult tickets cost $12 and student tickets cost $8. If 120 tickets were sold for a total of $1,120, how many of each ticket were sold?

At a farmers’ market, a shopper pays $11.50 for 2 kg of apples and 3 kg of bananas. Another shopper pays $12.50 for 5 kg of apples and 1 kg of bananas. Find the price per kilogram of apples and of bananas.
The sum of Mia’s and Noah’s current ages is 35. In 5 years, Mia will be twice Noah’s age. Find their current ages.
problems.answer: Mia is \(25\) years old and Noah is \(10\) years old

problems.q: A roaster blends a $12/kg coffee with an $18/kg coffee to make 10 kg of a $15/kg blend. How many kilograms of each coffee are used?
problems.answer: \(5\,\text{kg}\) of the \(\$12/\text{kg}\) coffee and \(5\,\text{kg}\) of the \(\$18/\text{kg}\) coffee

problems.q: A workout consists of running at 6 km/h and biking at 20 km/h for a total distance of 42 km in 3 hours. How long is spent on each activity?
A rectangle has a perimeter of 26 cm and an area of 40 cm^2. Find its length and width.
At a snack shop, 3 candy bars and 2 packs of gum cost $6.10, while 2 candy bars and 5 packs of gum cost $7.00. Find the price of one candy bar and one pack of gum.
A club sold T-shirts for $15 each and hoodies for $35 each. They sold 80 items in total and collected $2,300. How many T-shirts and how many hoodies were sold?
At a fundraiser, bracelets cost $4 and keychains cost $7. If 73 items were sold for $391, how many bracelets and how many keychains were sold?
On a phone plan, the bill is a fixed monthly fee plus a charge per gigabyte of data. One month with 6 GB cost $38; another month with 10 GB cost $54. Determine the fixed fee and the per-GB charge.
At a cinema snack bar, 2 large popcorns and 3 drinks cost $25.50, while 3 large popcorns and 2 drinks cost $27.00. Find the price of one large popcorn and one drink.
A commute involves walking at 4 km/h and then taking a bus at 48 km/h. The total travel time is 1 hour and the total distance is 28 km. How long is spent walking and how long on the bus?
A jar contains only quarters and dimes. There are 32 coins worth $5.30 in total. How many quarters and how many dimes are there?
A handyman charges a fixed visit fee plus an hourly rate. A 3-hour job costs $215, while a 5-hour job costs $295. Find the visit fee and the hourly rate.
A farm packs eggs in cartons of 12 and cartons of 18. In one shipment there are 23 cartons totaling 354 eggs. How many 12-egg cartons and how many 18-egg cartons are there?
A rental shop has single bikes for $12 per hour and tandem bikes for $20 per hour. During one hour they rented out 17 bikes and collected $268. How many of each type were rented?
A school store sold small notebooks for $2 and large notebooks for $5. If 120 notebooks were sold for a total of $420, how many small and how many large were sold?
A chemist mixes a 30% acid solution with a 50% acid solution to make 10 L of a 36% solution. How many liters of each solution are used?
A car rental charges a flat daily fee plus a per-mile charge. For a one-day rental, driving 120 miles costs $86, while 200 miles costs $118. Determine the daily fee and the per-mile charge.
A taxi charges a $3 flag-drop plus $1.80 per kilometer. You took two rides totaling $39.60. The longer ride was 6 km more than the shorter ride. How long was each ride?
